main event: A white object was sighted moving slowly in the sky for 30 to 45 minutes in Chesterton, Indiana on December 13, 1957.
interesting points: The object was moving very slowly and was in sight for 30 to 45 minutes.
The report states that the object could possibly have been a balloon or an astronomical object, but there was insufficient data for a conclusive evaluation.
The report indicates that there were no photographs taken of the sighting.
The observation was a ground-visual sighting.
The report is from a Project Blue Book record card.
